title: Apple introduces end-to-end encryption for backups
dot: digraph iCloudSecurity{subgraph cluster_iCloud{label="iCloud Security";"Apple Account"->"Two - factor authentication";"Apple Account"->"Standard data protection";"Apple Account"->"Advanced Data Protection for iCloud";"Standard data protection"->"End - to - end encrypted data (partial)";"Advanced Data Protection for iCloud"->"End - to - end encrypted data (more)";subgraph cluster_Standard{label="Standard data protection";"Standard data protection"->"Encryption in transit & at rest";"Standard data protection"->"Keys in Apple data centers";"Standard data protection"->"Apple can help with recovery";"Standard data protection"->"15 data categories end - to - end encrypted";}subgraph cluster_Advanced{label="Advanced Data Protection for iCloud";"Advanced Data Protection for iCloud"->"Higher level of security";"Advanced Data Protection for iCloud"->"Keys on trusted devices";"Advanced Data Protection for iCloud"->"25 data categories end - to - end encrypted";"Advanced Data Protection for iCloud"->"Recovery options: passcode, recovery contact, recovery key";}subgraph cluster_EndToEnd{label="End - to - end encrypted data";"End - to - end encrypted data"->"Decrypted only on trusted devices";"End - to - end encrypted data"->"Not accessible by Apple";"End - to - end encrypted data"->"Secure in case of data breach";}"Standard data protection"->"Table of data protection";"Advanced Data Protection for iCloud"->"Table of data protection";"Standard data protection"->"Metadata under standard protection";"Advanced Data Protection for iCloud"->"Metadata still some under standard";"Advanced Data Protection for iCloud"->"Sharing with end - to - end encryption (conditions)";"Standard data protection"->"Sharing without end - to - end encryption";"Advanced Data Protection for iCloud"->"iCloud.com access (disabled by default)";"Advanced Data Protection for iCloud"->"Third - party app data encryption";}}
